```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)
theme_set(theme_light())
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
recent_grads <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fivethirtyeight/data/master/college-majors/recent-grads.csv")

# first data cleaning
major_processed <- recent_grads %>%
    arrange(desc(Median)) %>% 
    mutate(Major = str_to_title(Major), # converts uppercased characters to titlecased
           Major = fct_reorder(Major, Median)) 
```


# What are the highest earning majors?

```{r echo=FALSE}
major_processed %>% 
    filter(Sample_size >= 100) %>% 
    head(10) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(Major, Median, color = Major_category)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = P25th, ymax = P75th)) +
    expand_limits(y = 0) +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = dollar_format()) +
    coord_flip() +
    labs(title = "What are the highest-earning majors",
         subtitle = "Top 20 majors with at lease 100 graduades surveyed",
         x = "",
         y = "Median salary of graduades")
```

### Most common majors (32min)

```{r echo=FALSE}
# show categories with highest major's 
major_processed %>% 
    mutate(Major_category = fct_reorder(Major, Total)) %>% 
    arrange(desc(Total)) %>% 
    head(20) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(Major_category, Total, fill = Major_category)) +
    geom_col() +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = comma_format()) +
    labs(x = "",
         y = "Total number of graduates")
```




```{r echo=FALSE}
major_processed %>% 
    mutate(Major_category = fct_reorder(Major_category, Median)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(Major_category, Median)) +
    geom_boxplot() +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = dollar_format()) +
    coord_flip()
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
major_processed %>% 
    mutate(Major_category = fct_reorder(Major_category, Median)) %>% 
    group_by(Major_category) %>% 
    summarise(Median = median(Median)) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(Major_category, Median)) +
    geom_col() +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = dollar_format()) +
    coord_flip()
```

What are the hightest Majors?


### How does gender breakdown relate to typical earnings? (36min)

```{r}
major_processed %>% 
    arrange(desc(Total)) %>% # will display top Majors by the count of people
    head(20) %>% 
    mutate(Major = fct_reorder(Major, Total)) %>% 
    gather(Gender, Number, Men, Women) %>% 
    select(Major, Gender, Number) %>% 
    ggplot(aes(Major, Number, fill = Gender)) +
    geom_col() +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = comma_format())
```
